abstract: Applebee’s plans a rebranding campaign that includes a wide-reaching advertising effort, new logo, new uniforms, redesigned restaurants and a new theme, “Together is good.”
snippet: Applebee’s plans a rebranding campaign that includes a wide-reaching advertising effort, new logo, new uniforms, redesigned restaurants and a new theme, “Together is good.”
lead_paragraph: DESPITE being the largest casual dining chain in America, Applebee’s International has long tried to position itself as a local gathering place. Its theme, “Eatin’ good in the neighborhood,” is reinforced by the décor of its restaurants, which can include pictures of local police officers and firefighters and memorabilia from regional sports teams.

headline.main: Polishing Up the Apple in Applebee’s
headline.print_headline: Polishing Up the Apple in Applebee’s

abstract: Apple’s new version of Leopard lists 300 new features, including a Braille font and a Danish spelling checker.
snippet: Apple’s new version of Leopard lists 300 new features, including a Braille font and a Danish spelling checker.
lead_paragraph: If you’re a computer company, what on earth do you add to the sixth annual version of your operating system?

headline.main: Apple Offers New Goodies in Leopard System
headline.print_headline: A Mac Leap, Courtesy Of Leopard

abstract: Serious music lovers probably fancy digital music servers — a jukebox for digital music files, a hard drive to store the files and software to pump it through an existing stereo system.
snippet: Serious music lovers probably fancy digital music servers — a jukebox for digital music files, a hard drive to store the files and software to pump it through an existing stereo system.
lead_paragraph: MUSIC lovers can easily jack their PC or iPod into their stereo system to hear their music collection on something with a little more oomph than earbuds.

headline.main: Digital Music to Please Even the Snobs
headline.print_headline: Digital Music to Please Even the Snobs

abstract: David Pogue notes some useful little tweaks to Apple’s latest operating system, Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard, that never get any press.
snippet: David Pogue notes some useful little tweaks to Apple’s latest operating system, Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard, that never get any press.
lead_paragraph: In today's Times, I reviewed Apple's latest operating system, Mac OS X 10.5 "Leopard." I noted that Apple claims to have added over 300 new features.

headline.main: More Goodies in Apple’s New Operating System

abstract: In a trend known as consumer-generated content, an 18-year-old student and Apple devotee was hired to make a television commercial for Apple’s new iPod Touch.
snippet: In a trend known as consumer-generated content, an 18-year-old student and Apple devotee was hired to make a television commercial for Apple’s new iPod Touch.
lead_paragraph: The idea that you do not have to be a professional to create a good commercial is becoming widespread, in a trend known as consumer-generated content. Leave it to Apple to ­ paraphrasing the company's old slogan a bit ­ think differently.

headline.main: Student’s Ad Gets a Remake, and Makes the Big Time

abstract: Gene Munster, an analyst at Piper Jaffray, calculates that AT&T is paying Apple $18 a month for every iPhone activated.
snippet: Gene Munster, an analyst at Piper Jaffray, calculates that AT&T is paying Apple $18 a month for every iPhone activated.
lead_paragraph: Apple doesn’t chat too much about the iPhone service fees AT&T shares with it. But the good folks at the Financial Accounting Standards Board (who make rules for how companies keep their books) have forced it to give us some clues. The accountants say that if someone promises to pay you money in the future (as AT&T does for each iPhone activated), you have to report this “deferred revenue” to investors.
